instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2375: What is 820-2375? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2375</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-Ano picture only beeping
threads.message:
Hello;

I got a macbook air today with the next problem.
when powering it it beeps continiously, and no chime is coming and no picture is showing

where should I start measuring?

thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2375</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-Ano picture only beeping
threads.message: Bad MCP79U, these boards go straight in the trash. Do not attempt to fix these machines, they are garbage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2375</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-Ano picture only beeping
threads.message:
I need to know more about what the problem is concerning the MCP79U. Is the chip totally dead or a reball can repair the problem? If the Chip totally dead can changing the chip help the problem?
Boards for such macbook are still costy and the customer cannot afford spending 300,-$ for a refubished board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2375</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-Ano picture only beeping
threads.message: There are no new chips so this cannot be fixed, the end.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2375</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-Ano picture only beeping
threads.message: How can I confirm that the MCP79U is faulty by measuring?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2375</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-Ano picture only beeping
threads.message: You can't. Just take from me that it is. Reball, reflow, replace do whatever you want but this thing is not worth time and effort. Do NOT repair these pieces of shit!
